I am always a little dubious whenever things like `U' * ΔA * U`
shows up in a pullback,
because i looks like it  violates the rule that linear operators can be written as affine expressions (in the type theory sense, of affine meaning each input is used at most once)
In correct rules it will either be divided out (which seems like it is just a waste of work),
or `U` will actually not be an input but something being closed over.
